ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Dichotomous: Socially directed speech and sounds
Notes: 1 = Symptom is not present; 3 = Symptom is present

ElementDescription: Dichotomous: Frequent and flexible eye contact
Notes: 1 = Symptom is not present; 3 = Symptom is present

ElementDescription: Dichotomous: Unusual vocalizations
Notes: 1 = Symptom is not present; 3 = Symptom is present

ElementDescription: Dichotomous: Unusual or repetitive play
Notes: 1 = Symptom is not present; 3 = Symptom is present

ElementDescription: Dichotomous: Unusual or repetitive body movements
Notes: 1 = Symptom is not present; 3 = Symptom is present

ElementDescription: Dichotomous: Combines gestures, eye contact, and speech/vocalization
Notes: 1 = Symptom is not present; 3 = Symptom is present

ElementDescription: Dichotomous: Unusual sensory exploration or reaction
Notes: 1 = Symptom is not present; 3 = Symptom is present

ElementDescription: Likert: Socially directed speech and sounds
Notes: 1 = Symptom not present; 2 = Symptom present but at subclinical levels; 3 = Symptom obviously consistent with Autism Spectrum

ElementDescription: Likert: Frequent and flexible eye contact
Notes: 1 = Symptom not present; 2 = Symptom present but at subclinical levels; 3 = Symptom obviously consistent with Autism Spectrum

ElementDescription: Likert: Unusual vocalizations
Notes: 1 = Symptom not present; 2 = Symptom present but at subclinical levels; 3 = Symptom obviously consistent with Autism Spectrum

ElementDescription: Likert: Unusual or repetitive play
Notes: 1 = Symptom not present; 2 = Symptom present but at subclinical levels; 3 = Symptom obviously consistent with Autism Spectrum

ElementDescription: Likert: Unusual or repetitive body movements
Notes: 1 = Symptom not present; 2 = Symptom present but at subclinical levels; 3 = Symptom obviously consistent with Autism Spectrum

ElementDescription: Likert: Combines gestures, eye contact, and speech/vocalization
Notes: 1 = Symptom not present; 2 = Symptom present but at subclinical levels; 3 = Symptom obviously consistent with Autism Spectrum

ElementDescription: Likert: Unusual sensory exploration or reaction
Notes: 1 = Symptom not present; 2 = Symptom present but at subclinical levels; 3 = Symptom obviously consistent with Autism Spectrum

ElementDescription: Autism Spectrum Disorder: Conclusion if forced to choose
Did you (clinician/interviewer) recommend in person evaluation for diagnostic clarification?
Diagnosis issued
How certain are you of your diagnostic impression?
Notes: 1 = Completely uncertain; 2 = Somewhat uncertain; 3 = Somewhat certain; 4 = Completely certain

ElementDescription: ASD PEDS Total Score
